burp suite for penitration testing

For CSS and HTML Dom manipulations

Decorators are used for enhancing and configuring classes, they provide metadata that Angular uses to define and configure different aspects of the application.
Decorates a class as an Angular component, providing metadata for the component.
Decorates a class as an Angular directive, providing metadata for the directive.
Decorates a class as an injectable service. Angular's dependency injection system uses this metadata to provide instances of the service.
Decorates a class property, indicating that the property's value will be supplied from the parent component.
Decorates a class property, indicating that the property can emit events to be handled by the parent component.
Decorates a class as an Angular module, providing metadata for the module.
Decorates a class property, allowing you to query and access child components or elements in the view.
Runs after an input/output binding has been changed.
Runs after a component has been initialized. Input bindings are ready.
Allows developers to perform custom actions during change detection.
Runs after the content of a component has been initialized.
Runs after every check of a component's content.
Runs after the view of a component has been initialized.
Runs after every check of a component's view.
Runs before a component is destroyed.

Data flows from component to the view and we can mix the same with HTML page.
Data flows from component to the view  eg: [value]
when you want to send event from the view to the component . eg: (click)
Data flows from component to the view and vice versa. Eg [(ngModel)]
splice method is used to change the contents of an array by removing or replacing existing elements by adding new elements in place.
slice method returns a portion of an array into a new array.

Encapsulation refers to the bundling of data and the methods that operate on the data into a single unit known as a class.
It helps in restricting access to some of the object's components and preventing unintended interference.

Inheritance allows a class to inherit the properties and methods of super class.
It promotes code reuse and establishes a hierarchy of classes.

Polymorphism allows objects of different classes to be treated as objects of a common base class.
It enables a single interface to represent different types of objects.

Abstraction involves hiding the complex reality while exposing only the necessary parts.
Abstract classes and interfaces are used to achieve abstraction.
Pipes are a way to transform data in templates before displaying it.
Directives extend the behavior of HTML elements in template.

Attribute Directives change the appearance or behavior of an element.
NgClass, NgStyle

Structural Directives alter the structure of the view by adding, removing, or manipulating elements in the DOM
NgIf, NgFor

can be identified by @directive()
ng g d mydirective

Lazy loading in Angular is a technique that defers the loading of certain modules until they are actually needed
helps in reducing initial bundle size

var - function-scoped 
They are visible throughout the entire function

let - block-scoped
They are limited to the block where they are defined.

const - block-scoped
Similar to let but values cannot be re-assigned

Promises handle a single asynchronous operation that produces either a resolved value or an error.
it has 2 parameters resolve and reject.

Observables handle streams of multiple values over time. They can emit multiple values, errors, and a completion signal.
subscribe method to handle emitted values, errors, and the completion of the observable.
unsubscribe method allows stopping the subscription and cleaning up resources.

async/await is used to simplify working with promises it allows to write asynchronous code that looks more like synchronous code for easier maintainability.
error can be handled by using try catch mechanism.

a function that calls itself
a function passed as an argument to another function
Class is a template or a blueprint It defines properties (attributes) and behaviors
Objects are real-world entities which have properties and beheviours/methods
Contains only method signatures
Document Object Model DOM treats each elements as an object and creates a tree like structures

for handling data that needs to be shared across multiple components within the application
It helps maintain consistency, improves performance, and simplifies complex applications
andling data specific to a single component it uses @Input & @Output Decorators to pass data in and out of the component
manage data that needs to be shared across multiple components it use the @Injectable decorator to create a service that can be injected into components.

For complex applications with extensive data sharing.
It follows principles of unidirectional data flow.
its building blocks includes Actions,Reducers,Effects and selectors.
components dispatch events called actions to update the state
the state changes are handled by functions called reducers which modifies the current state
Effects enable the usage of asynchronous operations such as api calls.
selectors extract specific pieces of state form overall application state for using it in different components in application.

mechanism for creating and delivering some parts of an application to other parts of an application that require them
Components, Directives
